# ARIB Broadcast Symbols mapping to Unicode
#
# Sources:
# - ARIB STD-B24 Table 7-10 "Additional Symbols"
# - ARIB STD-B24 mappings to Unicode, tables 7-19 and 7-20
# - Proposal document for encoding "Japanese TV Symbols" in Unicode
#   (L2/08-077R3)
# - PDAM 6.2 (L2/08-246)
# - UTC #116 Consensus [116-C25]: Encode U+26BD SOCCER BALL,
#   and move amendment 6 characters 26BD (ARIB 9316) and 26BE (ARIB 9071)
#   down by one codepoint to 26BE, 26BF.
#
# Notes:
# - This table maps to many Unicode code points for proposed,
#   not-yet-encoded characters.
#   Use this table only for standards work, not in production!
# - The Unicode unifications in L2/08-077R3 are a superset of those in
#   ARIB STD-B24 tables 7-19 and 7-20.
# - ARIB 9058 and 9330 (squared ideographic two) are unified.
#   In this mapping table, ARIB 9330 is round-tripped because it is in
#   a one-two-three sequence.
# - Some ARIB symbols are not directly encoded because they are glyph variants
#   of Unicode characters (e.g., ARIB 9226..9231) or represent sequences of
#   characters (e.g., 9256..9284).
#
# Columns:
# 1 ARIB row-cell code written as 4 digits:
#   2 decimal digits for row 90..94, and 2 decimal digits for cell 01..94
# 2 Unicode code point (4..6 hex digits)
#
# There are unused ARIB codes in rows 90..94. Blank lines indicate gaps.
9001  26CC
9002  26CD
9003  26CE
9004  26CF
9005  26D0
9006  26D1

9008  26D2
9009  26D5
9010  26D3
